exercises.answer: The manager will cut off the presentation unless the speaker reaches the conclusion within the allotted five minutes
exercises.hint: Start with 'The manager' and use 'unless' to show the condition for the speech to continue.
exercises.example_sentence: The manager will cut off the presentation unless the speaker reaches the conclusion within the allotted five minutes.

exercises.question: Say 'interpretation'.
exercises.hint: Stress the fourth syllable: in-ter-pre-TA-tion. This refers to the action of explaining the meaning of something.
exercises.example_sentence: Your interpretation of the data is valid although it differs significantly from the consensus of the research team.

exercises.question: Which phrasal verb means to call someone's attention to a particular fact or detail?
exercises.hint: Think of 'highlighting' or 'noting' a specific piece of information for others to see.
exercises.example_sentence: The auditor was quick to point out the errors although the accounting team had already submitted their final report.

exercises.question: We need the director to ___ the terms of the agreement; whereas, the current draft remains far too vague for a legal contract.
exercises.hint: Choose the phrasal verb that means to explain something very clearly and in great detail.
exercises.example_sentence: We need the director to spell out the terms of the agreement; whereas, the current draft remains far too vague for a legal contract.

exercises.question: Match the phrasal verbs with their closer descriptive academic or formal synonyms.
exercises.hint: One pair is about providing evidence or helping someone; the other is about researching a problem or situation.
exercises.example_sentence: You must back up your claims with data while the committee continues to look into the feasibility of your project.

exercises.question: Order the sentence to describe a improving professional relationship.
exercises.answer: Notwithstanding the initial friction the two departments eventually hit it off although they still disagree on minor logistical details
exercises.hint: Start with 'Notwithstanding' and use 'although' to contrast the new friendly relationship with remaining small arguments.
exercises.example_sentence: Notwithstanding the initial friction, the two departments eventually hit it off although they still disagree on minor logistical details.

exercises.question: Say 'collaboration'.
exercises.hint: Stress the fourth syllable: col-lab-o-RA-tion. This refers to the action of working with someone to produce something.
exercises.example_sentence: Successful collaboration is impossible unless all parties are willing to listen to opposing viewpoints.

exercises.question: Which phrasal verb means to succeed in making someone understand your meaning or to reach someone emotionally?
exercises.hint: Think of 'breaking through' a barrier to reach a person who is not listening.
exercises.example_sentence: It is difficult to get through to the CEO although his assistant has tried several times to explain our concerns.

exercises.question: The team needs to ___ the feedback from the clients; therefore, the launch has been postponed by another week.
exercises.hint: Choose the phrasal verb that means to examine or review something carefully.
exercises.example_sentence: The team needs to go over the feedback from the clients; therefore, the launch has been postponed by another week.

exercises.question: Match the phrasal verbs with their closer descriptive academic or formal synonyms.
exercises.hint: One pair is about saying 'no' to an offer or request; the other is about delaying an event until a later time.
exercises.example_sentence: We had to turn down the invitation so as to not put off our internal deadline any further.

exercises.question: Order the sentence for a legal news summary.
exercises.answer: The witness will not back down unless the defense attorney presents irrefutable evidence that proves the testimony is false
exercises.hint: Start with 'The witness' and use 'unless' to show the only way the person will change their position.
exercises.example_sentence: The witness will not back down unless the defense attorney presents irrefutable evidence that proves the testimony is false.

exercises.question: Say 'interpersonal'.
exercises.hint: Stress the fourth syllable: in-ter-PER-son-al. This adjective refers to relationships or communication between people.
exercises.example_sentence: Strong interpersonal skills are essential although technical expertise is often prioritized during the hiring process.

exercises.question: Which phrasal verb means to admire and respect someone?
exercises.hint: Think of a student admiring a teacher or a junior employee following a mentor.
exercises.example_sentence: Many young entrepreneurs look up to her although her business methods have recently been criticized by the press.

exercises.question: He managed to ___ his boss ___ the promotion; therefore, he will start his new role at the beginning of next month.
exercises.hint: Choose the phrasal verb that means to persuade someone to do something.
exercises.example_sentence: He managed to talk his boss into the promotion; therefore, he will start his new role at the beginning of next month.

exercises.question: Match the phrasal verbs with their closer descriptive academic or formal synonyms.
exercises.hint: One pair is about accepting an unpleasant situation without complaining; the other is about finally agreeing to something you didn't want to do.
exercises.example_sentence: We cannot put up with this noise anymore, but the landlord refuses to give in to our demands for a refund.

exercises.question: Order the sentence for a summary of a social conflict.
exercises.answer: Notwithstanding their differences they made it up quickly although the trust has not been fully restored
exercises.hint: Start with 'Notwithstanding' and use 'although' to contrast the quick apology with the lasting lack of trust.
exercises.example_sentence: Notwithstanding their differences, they made it up quickly although the trust has not been fully restored.

exercises.question: Say 'misunderstanding'.
exercises.hint: Stress the fourth syllable: mis-un-der-STAND-ing. This refers to a failure to understand something correctly.
exercises.example_sentence: The conflict arose due to a minor misunderstanding whereas both parties actually shared the same ultimate goal.
